intro: Leptosema anomalum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thornapple, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and feature five petals, often in shades of white or pink. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
